intro: Hieracium semileptoglossum, commonly known as the slender-lipped hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive, narrow corolla. It plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
